page.title: 02Queen Charlton Village
page.content: Queen Charlton is a small village to the south east of Bristol.It has a population of 71.There are 25 houses of which all are privately owned apart from 3 council houses and 2 tied cottages. There are 4 farms.A few villagers are employed on these,but most people work in Bristol or Keynsham.There is no public transport,so cars are essential,especially as the village has no shops,school or pub.It does have a 12th century church,a Norman arch,a medieval priest path and a small village green with a stone cross.The oldest house in the village dates from 1550. The village used to be known as Charlton.In 1574 after a visit by Queen Elizabeth I,it became Queen Charlton and a charter was granted for an annual fair,which is still held.
